title.narrative: ADOLESCENTS PARTICIPATION

description.narrative: By 2022, adolescents, especially the most vulnerable groups, have spaces and mechanisms to guarantee their effective right to participation., which contributes to Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, mothers, children, adolescents and families, especially the most vulnerable (on the northern border, indigenous peoples, Afrodescendants and others) and/or in emergency situations, exercise their right to health, education, water and sanitation and to informed and effective participation, with a focus on early childhood and adolescence

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, adolescents, especially the most vulnerable groups, have spaces and mechanisms to guarantee their effective right toparticipation.

description.narrative: To promote adolescent rights to effective participation in the country, the CO works with the government to ensure that the voices of youth are taken into account in decision-making processes. It works directly with adolescents and young people to ensure their empowerment. During 2021, we worked to achieve these goals primarily through three initiatives: DreamLAB, U-Report (Ecuador andUniendo Voces– On the Move), and Internet of Good Things (IoGT). We also strengthened engagement and awareness about the right to participate through a media campaign, GEN+. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022
